content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    re = r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```"m

    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    code = ""

    # Match all occurrences of Julia code blocks in the markdown document
    for match in eachmatch(re, md)
        # Get the captured group (the actual code block content)
        content = match.captures[1]

        # Remove the leading and trailing newlines from the matched content
        code *= strip(content) * "\n"
    end

    return code
end
```

This function uses a regular expression to match all ````julia` code blocks in the markdown document. It then iterates over each match, strips any leading and trailing newlines from the captured content (the actual code block), and concatenates them together with a newline character. Finally, it returns the combined string of all extracted Julia code blocks.
